alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 10:10PM EDT until July 18 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central and western Maine, including the following counties, in west central Maine, Somerset. In western Maine, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1008 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding, especially in areas that saw heavy rain earlier today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eustis, Kingfield, Carrabassett Valley, Phillips, Dallas Plantation, Caratunk Plantation, Pierce Pond, Carrying Place, Dead River and Highland Plantation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
